frameDefinitions: An Agent acts to  cause a Experiencer to feel a certain emotion.
An Entity loses moisture with the outcome of being in a dry state.
Under some Condition, usually left implicit, a Responsible_party is required to perform some Duty.
An Item is in a state of wetness with the possibility of the wetting Liquid being mentioned, along with the Degree of wetness. '
There is a gradable amount of light in a particular Location.
An Agent is responsible for having intentionally performed an Act or for being the or a primary instigator behind the Act.
frameExamples: I was so <t>offended</t> by her behaviour towards me.
It is my <t>duty</t> to fight any attack on the Brotherhood .
The mop is <t>drenched</t> with water from last night's rain.
The small print was bearly readable by the light of the very <t>dim</t> torch.
It has been determined that a relatively unknown terrorist group is <t>responsible</t> for the recent attacks.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person who's action's cause an emotion in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
The Experiencer feels an emotion as caused by the <fen>Agent</fen>.
The <fen>Event</fen> is the occasion or happening that evokes emotions in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>. This <fen>Event</fen> occurs as the direct result of a sentient being's actions.
When the Agent causes emotion in the Experiencer.
The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> causes the <fen>Experiencer</fen> to feel the emotion.
The <fen>Entity</fen> is the thing that loses moisture and becomes dry.
When the <fen>Entity</fen> becomes dry.
The location where the <fen>Entity</fen> becomes dry.
The person who must perform the <fen>Duty</fen>.
The action that the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> is obligated to perform.
The time interval during which the Responsibly_party is obligated to fulfill the Duty.
A location in which the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> has a specified <fen>Duty</fen> .
The <fen>Item</fen> takes up the <fen>Liquid</fen> through its pores.
The <fen>Liquid</fen> is a fluid or gas that permeates the <fen>Item</fen>.  It most frequently occurs in a PP Complement headed by with.
The place whose amout of light is being described.  The <fen>Location</fen> can also be a location in time, as seen in the second example below:
The entity from which the light eminates.
This role identifies the <fen>Act</fen> that the <fen>Agent</fen> performs intentionally.
The <fen>Agent</fen> performs the intentional act.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> acts intentionally.
This role identifies the place where the intentional act occurs.
listRoleExamples: <fex>You</fex> will perhaps be affronted by my frankness
My job is <fex>to get to the other side of the bridge</fex>.
<fex>At that time</fex> men were obligated to marry women from their own community.
I almost forgot to tell you that <fex>in Sweden</fex> we are obligated to spend atleast 7.5 months in the army for training.
The mop was drenched <fex> with water</fex>.
She hid from the man in a dark <fex>corner</fex>.
A dim <fex>lamp</fex> swung over the entrance to the castle.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the San Francisco Board of Education
Spirits of San Francisco: Voyages Through the Unknown City
